name: slogger
content:
slogger noun [C]
(HITTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
UK in sports such as cricket and rounders, a player who hits the ball hard with the bat, often in an uncontrolled way: I don't pretend to be a gifted batter and don't mind one bit being called a slogger. He has a reputation as a bit of a slogger but in fact he's a very skilled batsman.
More examplesFewer examplesShe picked up three late-innings wickets where sloggers skied catches.The last batter was out to the classic slogger's dismissal: caught on the midwicket boundary.The opener for our village team is the very opposite of a slogger: he is ultra-defensive.

slogger noun [C]
(WORKER)
mainly UK someone who works hard for a long time, although they may not be very skilled or have very interesting ideas : Everyone played their part, from the sloggers to the artistes. He was nicknamed "Slogger" for his unremitting hard work and persistence.

slogger noun [C]
(WALKER/RUNNER)
mainly UK (also foot slogger) a person or animal who keeps walking or running for a long time, usually slowly: The Gold Cup is often won by the sloggers - the horses that will really stay. Broadcasters covering the London Marathon have to find the balance between the professional event and the thousands of foot sloggers who trudge around behind.
